New Records: Italy came back from a 13-second deficit to stunningly beat France 3-1 in their UEFA Nations League match.
Kylian Mbappe failed to score for France despite being part of the starting lineup.
Key Match Events: France scored an early goal after just 13 seconds by Bradley Barcola.
Italy equalized on the half-hour mark with a goal from Federico Dimarco.
Italy took the lead in the 51st minute through Davide Frattesi's strike.
Italy extended their lead in the 74th minute with a goal from Giacomo Raspadori.
Italy's offensive efforts led to an 'expected goals' (xG) of 1.71 compared to France's 0.86.
Pre-Game Insights: France entered the match after their disappointment in the Euro 2024 semi-finals.
Italy aimed to make a strong start in their Nations League campaign.
Post-Match Reflections: Didier Deschamps' France struggled to bounce back after their early lead, leading to a tough post-match review.
Italy's comeback and performance were praised, especially the contributions of Mateo Retegui.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Italy's three goals came from different scorers, showcasing their offensive depth.
Bradley Barcola scored his first international goal in the match.
